aicpa-topic.title: FASB ASU No. 2019-05, Financial Instruments — Credit Losses (Topic 326): Targeted Transition Relief

body.p: In May 2019, FASB issued ASU No. 2019-05, to provide entities that have certain instruments within the scope of FASB ASC 326-20 with an option to irrevocably elect the fair value option applied on an instrument-by-instrument basis for certain financial assets upon the adoption of FASB ASC 326, Financial Instruments — Credit Losses. The fair value option election does not apply to held-to-maturity debt securities. An entity that elects the fair value option should subsequently apply the guidance in FASB ASC 820-10 and 825-10.
For entities that have not yet adopted the amendments in ASU No. 2016-13, the effective date and transition methodology for the amendments in ASU No. 2019-05 are the same as in ASU No. 2016-13.

For entities that have adopted the amendments in ASU No. 2016-13, the amendments in ASU No. 2019-05 are effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2019, including interim periods within those fiscal years. Early adoption is permitted in any interim period after the issuance of ASU No. 2019-05, as long as an entity has adopted the amendments in ASU No. 2016-13.
